newsitem.title: GERMANY: Degussa sells unit part of disinvestment plan.
newsitem.headline: Degussa sells unit part of disinvestment plan.

text.p: German chemicals and metals group Degussa AG said on Wednesday it planned to sell an associated company in Singapore for 57 million marks as part of an overall strategy to streamline its portfolio.

In a statement Degussa said it had agreed to sell Degussa Electronics Pte Ltd to Singapore-based Pentex-Schweizer Circuits Limited and was awaiting approval from the buyer's shareholders. The group makes circuit boards and posted sales of almost 90 million marks in the 1995/1996 business year.

The deal should earn Degussa 57 million marks and would complete Degussa's disinvestment programme in certain business areas, the group said, adding the step underscored Degussa's goal to exit all business related to non-precious metals.

Degussa has recently delighted analysts with its new-found commitment to concentrating on core business areas but today's news failed to move the group's share price, trading unchanged at 735 marks in early Frankfurt floor trading. Meanwhile the broader 30-share DAX index traded up 0.56 percent at 3,339.29.
